description: From Latin excōgitāre, from ex- + cōgitāre (“think”).

verbs.description: excogitate (third-person singular simple present excogitates, present participle excogitating, simple past and past participle excogitated)

entries.meaning: To think over something carefully; to consider fully; cogitate.
examples: The first organs which Gall excogitated, he placed in the region of the sinus; and it is manifest he was then in happy unacquaintance with everything connected with that obnoxious cavity.

entries.meaning: To reach as a conclusion through reason or careful thought.
examples: After many years of study, he excogitated a solution.
